about the future you simply do subject
plus will plus the infinitive for

learners over use will to speak about

depending on the situation and what we
are trying to communicate going to or
gonna and will are not alternatives
depending on what you are trying to say
you need to use one or the other the

continuous not going to for future
arrangements however the difference is
really small and using the two when

used when we are not certain about the
future plan going to shows that we have
decided to do something and the present
continuous is even more precise giving
the actual future date for the plan so
for example I am flying to India this
Saturday with going to we wouldn't
include the future date I'm going to
spend my vacation in India with will we
would probably include some uncertainty
